tweet: The House just voted to advance our #impeachment inquiry to a public phase. Soon, more evidence will be laid out for the American people, and no amount of smears or spin from this administration will stop this ongoing search for answers. We must continue to #FollowTheFacts.

Today, @TransportDems is holding a hearing with Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg to get answers regarding the deadly 737 Max crashes that claimed hundreds of lives. We need to know what failings led to these tragedies, and how we can prevent them from happening again.

Today marks one year since the horrific shooting at #TreeOfLife Synagogue in Pittsburgh. Since then, even more innocent people have been killed in their place of worship. We must honor them all by committing ourselves to ending hate, bigotry and gun violence wherever it exists.

I just voted for a resolution I cosponsored opposing the President's decision to pull troops from Northern Syria and condemning Turkish incursion against our Kurdish allies. U.S. troop withdrawal should be smart and methodical, not reckless and irresponsible. We must do better.

As Jewish people observe #YomKippur, the tragic shooting near a synagogue in Germany serves as a sobering reminder that antisemitism is still alive and well. On this holy day, I encourage all of us to atone for the sins of the past and pledge to create a more peaceful future.

Shelly Fitzgerald, who lost her job at Roncalli High School because she's gay, has turned injustice into activism. I was honored to write letters of support for both of these non-profits' grants. And I'll keep fighting to make sure your tax dollars benefit our community!

Even better is that both of these grants will be invested in the @IndyEastPZ which is helping to leverage federal grants with private and local government funding to create more job opportunities for the Hoosiers who live there.

And @RecycleForce has received $800,000, also from @HHSGov, to continue its efforts to reduce recidivism by providing training and work opportunities for returning citizens. This is in addition to a grant from @USDOL to advance this work.

Good news! Some great local organizations have been awarded federal grants that will strengthen their service to our community.

@EdnaMartinCtr has received $800,000 from @HHSGov to expand its Leadership and Legacy Campus Center, which will create 36 full-time, year round jobs.
